scheme_name: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Storage of Minimum 50-Ton Capacity - Haryana
brief_description: This scheme provides financial assistance for setting up ice plants or cold storage units with a minimum capacity of 50 tons, supporting cold chain infrastructure under PMMSY.
detailed_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Ice Plant/Cold Storage of Minimum 50-Ton Capacity , introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide financial assistance for setting up ice plants or cold storage units with a minimum capacity of 50 tons, supporting cold chain infrastructure under PMMSY. The aim is to reduce post-harvest losses and improve fish quality. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, funded in the ratio of: 50% by the Central Government, and 50% by the State Government. The beneficiary must operate and maintain the plant and ensure supply of ice to fishers at affordable prices.
benefits: A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP). The applicant must own land or hold a registered lease for a minimum period of 10 years. The applicant must submit an undertaking within the DPR/SCP, accepting full responsibility for operating and maintaining the unit. The applicant must provide ice at affordable prices to fishers. The applicant must submit a Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) in accordance with PMMSY guidelines. The applicant must hold a valid training certificate in ice plant or cold storage operation and maintenance. The applicant must ensure the land is free from legal issues and must provide a valid land title.
